name: Diabetes
description: A chronic disease that affects how your body turns food into energy.

name: Tension
description: Condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.
prevention: Eat a balanced diet low in sodium

name: Asthma
description: Chronic lung disease that inflames and narrows the airways.
symptoms: Trouble sleeping due to coughing or wheezing

name: COVID-19
description: Infectious disease caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
symptoms: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
prevention: Wear a mask in public places

name: Alzheimer
description: Progressive disorder that causes brain cells to degenerate and die.
prevention: Eat a healthy diet rich in fruits and vegetables

name: Arthritis
description: Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness that worsens with age.
symptoms: Redness of the skin around the joint

name: Fever
description: An elevated body temperature, usually due to an infection.

name: Depression
description: Mood disorder that causes persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
symptoms: Loss of interest in activities once enjoyed

name: Osteoporosis
description: Condition that weakens bones, making them fragile and more likely to break.
symptoms: Bone fractures that occur more easily than expected
prevention: Consuming adequate calcium and vitamin D
Avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol consumption

name: Cancer
description: A group of diseases characterized by the uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells.
symptoms: Lump or thickening in the breast or elsewhere
A sore that does not heal
Change in bowel or bladder habits

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
description: Progressive lung disease that makes it hard to breathe.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities

name: Stroke
description: Damage to the brain from interruption of its blood supply.
symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness in the face, arm, or leg
Sudden trouble seeing in one or both eyes
Sudden trouble walking, dizziness, loss of balance or coordination
Severe headache with no known cause

name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance, loss of consciousness, or convulsions.
symptoms: Uncontrollable jerking movements of the arms and legs
prevention: Avoid triggers (such as lack of sleep or alcohol)

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: Progressive loss of kidney function over time.
symptoms: Changes in how much you urinate

name: HIV/AIDS
description: Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) attacks the body’s immune system, specifically the CD4 cells (T cells), which help the immune system fight off infections.
treatments: Supportive care (nutritional support, mental health counseling)
prevention: Get tested and know your partner’s HIV status
Take pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) if at high risk

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: Progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
symptoms: Loss of automatic movements (e.g., blinking, smiling)
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent Parkinson’s disease.
Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms.

name: Obesity
description: A medical condition in which excess body fat has accumulated to an extent that it may have a negative effect on health.
prevention: Avoid excessive consumption of sugars and fats
Seek medical advice for weight management

name: Celiac Disease
description: An autoimmune disorder that can occur in genetically predisposed people where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine.
treatments: Medications for associated conditions (e.g., acid reflux)
prevention: Read labels and ingredient lists carefully
Educate family and friends about the condition

name: Anemia
description: Condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.
treatments: Vitamin B12 supplementation (in certain types of anemia)
Erythropoietin-stimulating agents (for some types of anemia)
prevention: Eat a diet rich in iron and vitamins

name: Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)
description: A condition that makes your skin red and itchy. It's common in children but can occur at any age.
treatments: Calcineurin inhibitors (for moderate to severe cases)
prevention: Identify and avoid triggers (e.g., allergens, stress)

name: Crohn's Disease
description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent Crohn's disease.
Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms and prevent complications.

name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
description: A potentially disabling disease of the brain and spinal cord (central nervous system).
symptoms: Numbness or weakness in one or more limbs
Electric-shock sensations that occur with certain neck movements
Tremor, lack of coordination or unsteady gait
Partial or complete loss of vision, usually in one eye at a time
Double vision or blurring of vision
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent multiple sclerosis.
Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms and slow progression.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.
symptoms: Morning stiffness that may last for hours
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent rheumatoid arthritis.
Early diagnosis and appropriate treatment can help manage symptoms and slow progression.

name: Heart Disease
description: A range of conditions that affect your heart, including coronary artery disease, heart attack, and heart failure.
symptoms: Chest pain, chest tightness, chest pressure and chest discomfort (angina)
Pain, numbness, weakness or coldness in your legs or arms if the blood vessels in those parts of your body are narrowed
Pain in the neck, jaw, throat, upper abdomen or back
prevention: Exercise for about 30 minutes on most days of the week

name: Gout
description: A form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by recurrent attacks of a red, tender, hot, and swollen joint.
symptoms: Peeling and itching of the skin
Hard lumps of uric acid crystals under the skin
treatments: Medications to lower uric acid levels (allopurinol, febuxostat)
prevention: Avoid high-purine foods (e.g., red meat, seafood)

name: Type 2 Diabetes
description: A chronic condition that affects the way your body metabolizes sugar (glucose), an important source of fuel for your body.

name: Fibromyalgia
description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory, and mood issues.
symptoms: Cognitive difficulties (often referred to as 'fibro fog')
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent fibromyalgia.
Early diagnosis and appropriate treatment can help manage symptoms.

name: Hepatitis B
description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus that's easily preventable by a vaccine.
prevention: Use condoms or avoid sexual contact with infected individuals
Get screened if you are at risk

name: Migraine
description: A severe, throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound.
symptoms: Moderate to severe pain, usually confined to one side of the head but capable of occurring on either side of the head
The pain is often described as pulsating or throbbing
Sensitivity to light, sounds, and sometimes smells
prevention: Identify and avoid triggers (e.g., certain foods, stress)

name: Psoriasis
description: A condition in which skin cells build up and form scales and itchy, dry patches.
symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with thick, silvery scales
Small scaling spots (commonly seen in children)
Dry, cracked skin that may bleed
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent psoriasis.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: A degenerative joint disease caused by wear and tear on the joints.

name: Sleep Apnea
description: A potentially serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts.
symptoms: Episodes of breathing cessation during sleep
prevention: Use a humidifier if dry air aggravates symptoms

name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
description: A digestive disorder that affects the lower esophageal sphincter (LES), the ring of muscle between the esophagus and stomach.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
Sensation of a lump in your throat

name: Glaucoma
description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often associated with elevated pressure in the eye.
symptoms: Patchy blind spots in your side (peripheral) or central vision, frequently in both eyes
Tunnel vision in the advanced stages
prevention: Know your family's eye health history

name: Tuberculosis (TB)
description: A potentially serious infectious disease that mainly affects your lungs.
symptoms: Coughing that lasts three or more weeks
treatments: Preventive treatment for those at high risk
prevention: Avoiding exposure to people with active TB
Treatment of latent TB infection in high-risk individuals
Good ventilation in living and working spaces

name: COPD (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease)
description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, especially during physical activities
prevention: Quit smoking and avoid secondhand smoke
Avoid exposure to indoor and outdoor pollutants
Get vaccinated against influenza and pneumonia

name: Osteoporosis
description: A condition in which bones become weak and brittle.
symptoms: Back pain, caused by a fractured or collapsed vertebra
A bone that breaks much more easily than expected
prevention: Get enough calcium and vitamin D

name: Hypothyroidism
description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent hypothyroidism.
Early detection and treatment can prevent complications.

name: Cataracts
description: Clouding of the normally clear lens of your eye.
symptoms: Increasing difficulty with vision at night
Need for brighter light for reading and other activities
Frequent changes in eyeglass or contact lens prescription
treatments: Surgery to remove the clouded lens and replace it with a clear artificial lens
prevention: Protect your eyes from ultraviolet sunlight

name: Endometriosis
description: An often painful disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of your uterus — the endometrium — grows outside your uterus.
treatments: Hormonal therapies (birth control pills, GnRH agonists)
Surgery to remove endometrial growths or hysterectomy (in severe cases)
Fertility treatment (if infertility is an issue)
prevention: There are no known ways to prevent endometriosis.
Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms and preserve fertility.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
description: A common disorder that affects the large intestine (colon), characterized by abdominal pain, cramping, bloating, gas, diarrhea, and constipation.
symptoms: Diarrhea or constipation, sometimes alternating bouts of diarrhea and constipation
treatments: Dietary changes (increased fiber, avoiding gluten, low FODMAP diet)
prevention: Identify and avoid triggers (certain foods, stress)
